text: Rupela tinctella is a moth in the family Crambidae. It was described by Francis Walker in 1863. It is found in Florida, Georgia, Louisiana, Mississippi, North Carolina, South Carolina, Texas,Moth Photographers Group. Mississippi State University. Mexico, Cuba, the Guianas, Trinidad, Brazil (Paraná), Paraguay and northern Argentina. The wingspan is 20–34 mm for males and 25–42 mm for females. The forewings and hindwings of the males are pale brown or brownish ochreous. The wings of the females range from sordid white to pure white. Adults have been recorded on wing from March to October. ==References== Category:Moths described in 1863 Category:Schoenobiinae
title: Rupela tinctella
